text: Randall Stout (May 6, 1958 - July 11, 2014) was an American architect. Stout was born in Knoxville, Tennessee. His best known works were the Hunter Museum of American Art in Chattanooga, Tennessee, the Taubman Museum of Art in Roanoke, Virginia, and the Abroms-Engel Institute for the Visual Arts in Birmingham, Alabama. Stout died from renal cell carcinoma in Los Angeles, California, aged 56. ==References== Category:1958 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Deaths from kidney cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:American architects Category:People from Knoxville, Tennessee
title: Randall Stout
